message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and specifically focuses on sentence simplification. Additionally, the paper uses Sequence-to-Sequence models, which are commonly used in NLP tasks. 

It could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper discusses the use of machine learning models to perform sentence simplification. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category as the paper uses a discrete parametrization mechanism to provide explicit control on simplification systems based on Sequence-to-Sequence models. 

cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a possible sub-category as the paper uses neural networks to perform sentence simplification. 

Finally, cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a less likely sub-category as the paper does not explicitly focus on information retrieval, but rather on improving the performance of sentence simplification models.
